title: The Moonlight Lodge
short: Meta funded VR Multiplayer project about natural interactions with LLM agents.

sections.title: Project
sections.content: This is a VR multiplayer game where players need to communicate with synchronized LLMs to solve a murder mystery. Since this project hasn't been announced yet, there isn't much more I can share for now. What I can say is that it's the biggest project I've worked on, and I've had the opportunity to build it alongside industry veterans while still taking on a lot of responsibility. Interacting with the AI agents is done by layering LLMs for a stable and reliable output, generating visemes to interact with premade emotions, and generating voices.

sections.title: Responsibilities
sections.content: I was responsible for all front-end Unity-related work. My main objectives were to set up the multiplayer (Photon Fusion) and VR (MetaXR) aspects of the project. After this, I implemented all gameplay elements and maintained the Unity project. Performance was also crucial, since the target platform was Meta Quest 3 standalone. I was only partially involved in the AI interactions and in setting up behavior trees on the back end (server).

sections.title: Client
sections.content: Operative Games, co-founded by Jon Snoddy (former Disney Imagineering R&D leader), is a Los Angeles–based studio pioneering AI-driven interactive storytelling. My mentor on this project was Ryan Green, a BAFTA- and Game Award–winning indie game developer and creative director at Numinous Games. Alongside them, I worked with Hollywood audio engineers, storytellers, project managers, and many others. I also had the pleasure of meeting part of the team in Toronto, Canada.

title: Year of the Cicadas
short: A VR project funded by Unity about exploring grief for losing a child.

sections.title: Project
sections.content: Year of the Cicadas is an immersive VR experience that guides the player through Kim Hieftje's grieving process after the loss of her son Cody. The cicadas play a significant role in the project, as they only surface every dozen years and happened to be swarming Cody's tombstone right after he passed away.

sections.title: Responsibilities
sections.content: I wasn't involved during the entire development of the game, but more toward the end. During my time on the project, I mainly managed interns who were contributing to the development, helping them connect the dots, and doing an audio pass. I also stayed with Kim and her husband Bernard for a couple of weeks in Connecticut America, during which we had the chance to talk about her grief and relate it to my own.

sections.title: Client
sections.content: Kimberly (Kim) Hieftje, PhD is an Associate Professor of Pediatrics at Yale School of Medicine and co-director (and co-founder) of XR Pediatrics and the Yale Center for Immersive Technologies in Pediatrics. She leads research on immersive reality and serious games to promote health, behavior change, and education among youth.

title: Up With the Sub
short: A local co-op submarine adventure for a class project, voted as “Best Game of the Course 2020.” by our teachers.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content:
This project was created during the Game Projects course at DAE, a program where all majors come together to collaborate on a game. Together with two artists and another programmer, we successfully completed what became my first Unity project.

While learning the basics of Unity, I focused on implementing controllable characters, a simple crafting system, and the physics for both the items and the submarine.

Our project was highly praised by both students and teachers, earning the Teachers' Prize for Greatest Game of the Course of the Year. In 2025, I heard from my interns that it's still being showcased as an example during the course's introduction.
